metaDescription: Premium 2-bedroom bungalow in Pilar de La Horadada, €369,000. Modern holiday home near Blue Flag beaches. 40% cheaper than Spanish islands.
heroIntro: Discover your perfect Mediterranean escape in this stunning 2-bedroom bungalow nestled in the charming pueblo of Pilar de La Horadada. At €369,000, this premium property offers exceptional value—40% less expensive than comparable homes on Spanish islands while delivering the same sun-soaked lifestyle and coastal convenience. Imagine waking to Spanish sunshine, spending your days exploring pristine Blue Flag beaches just 20 minutes away, and your evenings dining al fresco in a welcoming international community. This isn't just a property investment; it's your ticket to the Mediterranean dream. Whether you're seeking a holiday home where memories are made, a second residence for year-round escapes, or a smart investment in one of Costa Blanca's most desirable locations, this bungalow delivers everything modern buyers crave. The region attracts thousands of holidaymakers annually, with typical weekly rental income around €800, making this an attractive income-generating asset when you're not enjoying it yourself. With 88m² of thoughtfully designed living space, 2 spacious bedrooms, and 2 full bathrooms, this property punches well above its weight. The established expat community ensures you'll never feel isolated, with English spoken throughout local shops, restaurants, and healthcare facilities. Welcome home to Costa Blanca.
areaSection: Pilar de La Horadada is a picturesque pueblo on Costa Blanca's southern coast, positioned perfectly between the vibrant energy of larger coastal towns and the authentic charm of traditional Spanish villages. Located in the Alicante province, this area enjoys over 300 days of Mediterranean sunshine annually, with mild winters and warm summers that make outdoor living irresistible. The pueblo itself maintains a genuine Spanish character while welcoming an international community, creating a unique cultural blend. Stunning beaches are minutes away—Blue Flag designated stretches of golden sand where crystal-clear waters invite swimming, paddleboarding, and water sports. The landscape transitions from coastal beaches to inland agricultural areas famous for citrus farming, offering diverse scenery and a genuine connection to the region's heritage. This location represents the sweet spot for holiday buyers: close enough to amenities and beaches for convenience, yet far enough from tourist-heavy areas to preserve authentic Spanish atmosphere.
lifestyleSection: Life in Pilar de La Horadada revolves around the Mediterranean rhythm—leisurely mornings at local cafés, afternoon beach sessions, and evening paseos through the pueblo. The established international community has created an English-friendly environment without sacrificing Spanish authenticity. Weekly markets overflow with fresh produce, local cheeses, and seafood from nearby ports. Major supermarkets including Mercadona and Lidl provide familiar shopping options, while family-run restaurants serve authentic paella and fresh catch alongside international cuisine. Healthcare is exceptional, with English-speaking doctors at private clinics and a regional hospital within 30 minutes. For active retirees and holiday seekers, championship golf courses are nearby, while water sports enthusiasts find world-class facilities. The expat network organizes social events, language exchanges, and community activities, ensuring you're never without companionship. The pace is relaxed yet social—you choose your level of engagement. Most importantly, you're never more than 20 minutes from stunning beaches where Mediterranean life feels tangible and real.

healthcare.text: Healthcare in Pilar de La Horadada meets international standards, with English-speaking doctors readily available at private clinics throughout the area. For comprehensive services, the Regional Hospital of San Juan (Alicante) is accessible within 25-30 minutes for emergency or specialist care. Many local general practitioners are British or have extensive experience treating international patients, understanding the specific health concerns of expatriates. Prescription medications are affordable compared to UK prices, and private health insurance for EU residents is surprisingly economical. Dental care and specialist services are excellent, with modern facilities and trained professionals. The healthcare infrastructure has developed specifically to support the large international community, removing any anxiety about medical access.

shopping.text: Weekly shopping is convenient with major supermarket chains within 5-10 minutes: Mercadona, Lidl, and Consum offer familiar products and competitive pricing. The combination of familiar supermarkets and authentic markets means daily life shopping blends convenience with genuine Mediterranean flavor.

faqs.question: Can foreigners buy property in Spain?
faqs.answer: Yes, absolutely. Non-Spanish residents and non-EU citizens can freely purchase property in Spain with minimal restrictions. You'll need an NIE (Spanish tax identification number) and should work with a Spanish lawyer to handle the legal process, but the procedure is straightforward. Thousands of British and international buyers own property on Costa Blanca without residency requirements.

faqs.question: What is the cost of living in Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Cost of living is significantly lower than UK prices. Groceries, dining, utilities, and services typically cost 20-40% less than Britain. A comfortable lifestyle including occasional dining out, utilities, and local activities costs €800-€1,200 monthly. This bungalow's low maintenance needs keep ongoing ownership costs minimal, making it ideal for retirees and holiday home owners.

faqs.question: Is Costa Blanca a good place to buy property?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca is an excellent property market combining lifestyle benefits, strong fundamentals, and established infrastructure. The region attracts 300+ days of annual sunshine, world-class beaches, championship golf courses, and an international community spanning 50+ nationalities. Market trends show +8% year-on-year growth with sustained demand from holiday and investment buyers. Property prices remain reasonable compared to Spanish islands or other Mediterranean destinations.

faqs.question: How far is Costa Blanca from the UK?
faqs.answer: Alicante-Elche Airport is approximately 45 minutes from this property and offers direct flights to most UK airports (typically 2-2.5 hour flight time). Many budget airlines operate regular routes, making weekend visits to family or flying friends and family to your holiday home convenient and affordable.

faqs.question: What is the weather like on Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Exceptional—over 300 days of Mediterranean sunshine annually with mild winters (12-15°C) and warm summers (25-30°C). Rainfall is minimal (200mm annually), making outdoor living the norm. This climate ensures your holiday home is genuinely usable year-round, with comfortable conditions even during winter months when much of Europe experiences grey skies.

faqs.question: Can I get a mortgage in Spain as a foreigner?
faqs.answer: Yes. EU residents and many non-EU nationals can obtain Spanish mortgages through major banks. Interest rates are competitive (currently 3-4% for qualifying borrowers), and lenders typically offer 80% loan-to-value financing. Working with a Spanish mortgage broker (who speak English) simplifies the process. This bungalow's €369,000 price is accessible through standard Spanish mortgage products.

faqs.question: What rental income can I expect from this property?
faqs.answer: Similar 2-bedroom properties in Pilar de La Horadada typically generate €600-€1,000 weekly during peak season (May-September), with rates dropping to €400-€600 off-season. Annual gross rental income realistically ranges €25,000-€40,000 depending on your marketing and booking management. Many owners achieve positive cash flow after maintenance, insurance, and management costs—essentially making the property self-funding or income-generating.

faqs.question: Is Pilar de La Horadada a safe place to live?
faqs.answer: Yes. Pilar de La Horadada is a safe, family-friendly pueblo with low crime rates. The established expat community has created a secure, welcoming environment where residents feel comfortable year-round. Local police presence is adequate, and the pueblo atmosphere—where neighbors know each other—contributes to genuine security and community cohesion.

faqs.question: What makes this property better value than island alternatives?
faqs.answer: This property costs €4,193/m² while comparable properties on Spanish islands (Mallorca, Menorca, Ibiza) typically cost €7,000-€10,000/m² for identical quality and size. You receive the same Mediterranean lifestyle, beaches, and amenities for 40% less investment. Additionally, Costa Blanca offers more established international infrastructure, larger expat networks, and stronger rental potential than many island properties.
